question.text: The gestation period in humans is

options.text: 280 days from the end of the last menstrual cycle
280 days from the day of insemination
280 days from the day of fertilization of the egg
266 days from the day of the start of the last menstrual cycle

solution.text: The fusion of a haploid male gamete (spermatozoan) and a haploid female gamete (ovum) to form a diploid zygote is called fertilization. In human females, fertilization is internal and it takes place in the ampulla of the fallopian tube. Fertilization occurs within 6 hours after ovulation. The condition of carrying one or more embryos in the uterus is called Pregnancy or Gestation. Human pregnancy lasts for an average of 266 days from fertilization of the egg or 280 days from the start of the last menstrual cycle.
